course.subject: COMP
course.name: Search Engines for Web and Enterprise Data
course.description: Text retrieval models, vector space model, document ranking, performance evaluation; indexing, pattern matching, relevance feedback, clustering; web search engines, authority-based ranking; enterprise data management, content creation, meta data, taxonomy, ontology; semantic web, digital libraries and knowledge management applications.
course.prerequisites: COMP 2011 OR COMP 2012 OR COMP 2012H

reviews.author: onion man
reviews.title: we need some real reviews here
reviews.comment_content:
COURSE WORK:
- 4 HW
- 1 MT
- PROJECT(2 Phases)
- 1 FINAL
-------------------------------

LECTURE Topics(in order but feels like he just randomly picked a topic after he finished the last one according to what shape he pooped that day~so the order might vary from different semester):

1. Intro
2. Vector Space Retrieval Models
3. Implementation Issues
4. Extended Boolean Model
5. SE for the Web
6. Web Search Matrix
7. Web Search(Clever)
8. Performance Evaluation
9. Automatic Indexing
10. Personalization
11. SVM Ranking
12.Term Similarity
13. Term Collocation
14. Enterprise SE
15. Summarization

Reminder: AGAIN if you wanna do a preview before each class do not trust the week schedule on canvas cuz it is probably the schedule 200 years ago

-------------------------------

LAB Topics (6 labs in total):
1. VM Set Up
2. Java and RocksDB
3. Parser
4. Page Processing
5. JSP
6. SVM

Reminder: Useless~Just needa go to the first one cuz it is quite complicated (to me) and read the slides for the rest
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor:
- Really proud of his teaching(um... I mean the professor himself)
- Talk about stuff that is irrelevant
- The ppt is just sth... that you can tell he might not know the ppt can be edited after they are made
- Talk real slowwwwwwwwwww

-------------------------------

TA:
welp... they are those who are FULLY in charge of your project grading and your assignment grading~ they are just average TAs (you can seek help from them when you get stuck in the project which I promise you will)

Little Tips: Girls are always better than guys
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:

Labs participation 1%

Lecture participation 1%

Homework 1 8%

Homework 2 10%

Homework 3 5%

Homework 4 5%

Mid term 15%

Project Phase 1 5%

Project Phase 2 20%

Final Exam 30%

Total 100%

Project bonus 3%

Highest possible score 103%

So many details about the weighting which are subject to changes every semester so please be alert and read the grading scheme on canvas carefully

-------------------------------
HW1 Mean 95.63/100
HW2 Mean 83.45/100
HW3 Mean 88.98/100
HW4 Mean 91.55/100
MT Mean 72.3/100
FINAL Mean 84.09/100
Project (Phase 1) Mean 4.78/5
Project (Phase 2) Mean 21.29/23
Lab and Class Participation Mean: 1.82/2

Onion Man:
MT 1SD higher
Final ~0.9 SD higher
Others: higher than mean a lil bit except grp project phase 2 and 1hw which are lower than mean a lil bit

FINAL GRADE: A- (you must be like oh not even 1 SD higher in final can get A range? ya cuz you are studying with a bunch of xxxxxx xxxxxxx)
reviews.comment_workload:
Really depends on your abilities and your interests in coding esp for java cuz you are expected to do the project in java

If you are not familiar with java and even coding plz do not try to put your life on the line

FOR ME THIS COURSE IS HELL!

Anyone who suggests you this course is butt hole and i guess they hate you. Find other friends la. You deserve better.

reviews.author: smallpotato tom
reviews.title: The grading becomes bad (for me) in this semester
reviews.comment_content:
The topics are around "Search Engine", or called "Information Retrieval". Methodology and performance are both covered. Quite useful for CSE students.

1. Introduction

2. Information Retrieval Models and Inverted Files
- Boolean model, vector space model, inverted files, Blair and Maron's evaluation

3. Web-based Information Retrieval
- Hypursuit, WISE, PageRank, HITS

4. Retrieval Effectiveness and Performance Measures

5. Document Preprocessing
-   Stop-word removal and stemming

6. Relevance Feedback and Functionality Overview

7. Document Analysis and Semantic Tools
- Term selection, term collocation, term phrase formation, personalization and SVM

8. Enterprise Search

9. Advanced Applications (Document Summarization)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Dik Lee was a good guy, but his tone was really boring.

The notes could be better designed, like the name of topic. Some information was outdated.

Labs were really, really bad. Lab materials were not explanatory enough. The ability of TAs was obviously not acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good for some people, but also bad for many people. Let's review on the grading scheme first:

Homework 1 - 8%
Homework 2 - 14%
Homework 3 - 10%
Take-home Midterm (3 hours) - 10%
Project Phase 1 - 5%
Project Phase 2 - 25%
Take-home Final (3 hours) - 24%
Lecture Attendance - 1%
Lab Attendance - 1%

As we had lessons online, the grading scheme had been tuned, especially for the exams. You can see the weighting of both exam did not contribute much to the final grade - that's a problem. Many people could get similar scores in this semester, so if there was a slight mark difference between people, the grades between them could be greatly different. For example, if 87/100 (final score) get a B+, 85/100 will receive a B-. Two sub-grades! It's real!

I actually got above mean for most of the things but below mean in the final, finally received a B-. Some people might think it's good grade, but I don't think so (at least for this semester).
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload was heavy.

3 Assignments, 2 of them involved programming work.

Project required us to make a search engine on CSE webpages. It consumed a lot of time and effort. The labs would teach a bit skills for the project, but not that helpful. Some important skills (especially those for handling RocksDB) were not taught at all.

The final exam asked a lot of questions that are not covered in the assignments. The examples in the lecture notes were not explanatory, so basically it's difficult to follow the notes to finish the exam.

reviews.author: Yifan
reviews.title: You get to write a basic web scraper and a search engine in Java
reviews.comment_content:
The framework is Java. Contents are pretty old but still fine and interesting. You will end up with a functional web scrapper and search engine. Pretty meaningful in my opinion.

Course Outline
1. Introduction and course overview
2. Business models
3*. Information retrieval models and Inverted Files
4. Web-based information retrieval
5*. Pattern matching and extended Boolean model
6. Retrieval effectiveness, benchmarking
7*. Document preprocessing
8*. Query expansion and relevance feedback
9. Applications: text summarization
10. Applications: recommendation systems

I would say the * ones are most relevant to the project, you will have to understand inverse documents, how to implement the ranking factor, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most things are explained just fine. Plenty of discussion about content outside of the slides that are sometimes interesting. Contents are explained well in the slides. You can find all the important formulas in the slides so I think it is acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading:
0%* - Lecture/Labs participation
5% - Homework 1
10% - Homework 2
10% - Homework 3
5% - Homework 4
15% - Mid term
0%* - Project Phase 1 (Group formation)
15% - Project Phase 2
40% - Final Exam
100% - Total

You have to attend 70% of the (labs + lectures); if you do not meet this requirement, you will fail the course. (Don't like it but it did motivated me to go to the lectures and stay updated about the course so it works for me)

I got around 83.35% out of 100%. => B
reviews.comment_workload:
Exams feels pretty easy, because we had open book online exams.

For homework, you don't need to write too much, but solid understanding is required. Need to be very careful to not make careless mistakes to get good marks. I would say around 3-4 hours per homework.

For project, I basically carried our team of 3. I would say I wrote like 90% of the code. They helped with documentations stuff that I didn't want to write so I am ok with that. Note, you will need to actually design the way data is stored, so pay attention to those in lectures.

Because I had pretty solid understanding of what to do, and I have pretty good experience with Java, I didn't find the process too stressful. The sad thing was that their instruction was not clear about how many pages to scrap, I would recommend scraping as much as you can so that when you demo, the correct page will show up in the search result. We failed :(  though I am 90% sure that our code is correct, just need to scrap like 10 times more pages.

reviews.author: Never Social
reviews.title: It's all common sense
reviews.comment_content:
Low level view of search engine.

As useless as it can get, I can't see how this is market relevant, it's probably never designed to be so.
reviews.comment_teaching: It's fine, lecture notes organization is a joke tho. Personally, I just AFK the attendance requirement and play the recordings at 2.5 speed.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite relax, I believe I got 1.5 SD on both midterm and exam near full project and homework, got A+ at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Lecture notes seem to have a lot of details, but just refer to the past papers and u notice they just ask those couple concepts, which is just 20% of the lecture notes.

reviews.author: alextangdoug
reviews.title: Good course for learn sth abt data science
reviews.comment_content:
Good lecturer, good content which is updated to time.
But It is a bit theoretical. The performance evaluation part really helps if you're targeting data science relate interview.

It also contains some contents about NLP, which might be useful if you are going to be a data scientist
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good teaching. With a good pace. lecturer is very good guy patient to answer questions. TA is a bit useless. The course is quite fun and lecture notes are well organized.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is not bad. BTW I am not very hardworking guy and I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite high if you are doing the project from your own.
Assignments is not very hard and time consuming.

reviews.author: ustskyyyyyy
reviews.comment_content:
Content is about indexing and ranking webpage, queuing/feedback about search engine, and etc.

Many content but most are not practical/useful now.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Prof. is nice. If you are interesting in search engine, the lecture is not bored.

The TA is very good, you can ask anything and they will help your homework and project.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lab attendance 1%
Lecture attendance 2%
Homework 20%
Project 25%
Midterm 15%
Final 37%
(Project Bonus 3%)

A 15%
B 40%
C 40%
D/F 5%

The 3% bonus comes from demo to the TAs.
After the demo, the TAs will invite some groups to present during lecture and the groups get 5% of the project.

The mean of the midterm and final is ~7x.
More than half of the class get B range or above, definitely a good grade course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Two homework, just some short questions which are not difficult. Almost everyone gets 9x~100.

The midterm and final exam is open-notes so it is not difficult.

The workload of this course mostly comes from the project. The project required your group to implement a search engine using whatever programming language you want( java is suggested ). It takes some time to do this. There are many details you can implement, this is not required but you can get bonus.

Overall, this course is not difficult and won't take you many time.

reviews.author: sapnu
reviews.comment_content:
We discuss a lot about search engine, starting from its history all the way until present use and future development.
Topics covered include some algorithm for search engine and information retrieval, as well as the difference between commercial search engine and enterprise search engine.
Project is doable after he discussed about the algorithm for search engine, which he covers before midterm, so you can start early on your project.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a very passionate guy. He did a lot of research and work around search engine for as long as he lived.
Very knowledgeable and will answer your question promptly

Lab and TAs are not so helpful, especially if you want to use language other than java and rocksDB
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade is really good, compare to other comp courses (if you know what I mean)
For the project, do as much bonus as you can, because the mean is quite high for the project.
Midterm and final were not so bad if you take a couple of days to study and listen to his lecture.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 1 term project and 3 homework, midterm and final.
Homeworks are doable in a couple of hours and help you revise for the exam as well
Don't procrastinate for the project. If you start the project early, you will be sure to get good results. Can use any language you like.
